function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Effectiveness of NPHIs is challenging to evaluate due to different measures and study types used","Impact":"Inability to determine the true impact of interventions on disease control","Mitigation":"Standardization of study methods and measures for evaluating NPHI effectiveness","Technologies":"Data standardization technologies, meta-analysis tools","People":"Researchers, policymakers","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Single studies conducted in specific communities may not provide conclusive evidence of NPHI effectiveness","Impact":"Limited generalizability and reliability of study findings","Mitigation":"Conducting systematic review and meta-analysis to consolidate evidence across multiple studies","Technologies":"Systematic review software, meta-analysis tools","People":"Researchers, policymakers","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Risk of bias in comparing outcomes of communities with and without NPHIs","Impact":"Misinterpretation of the true impact of NPHIs on disease outcomes","Mitigation":"Careful consideration of confounding variables and use of appropriate statistical methods","Technologies":"Statistical software, regression analysis tools","People":"Epidemiologists, statisticians","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"}]}
